input_text:
Job Title: Researcher (Oral Immunology and Infectious Diseases )

Location: Louisville, KY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Department:

Oral Immun & Infect Dis

Location:

Health Sciences Center

Time Type:

Full time

Worker Type:

Regular

Job Req ID:

R104263

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a related field and 6 years of relevant experience. Additional experience may be used to offset the educational requirements.

Position Description:

This position will entail performing cellular biology and animal experiments related to a NIDCR R01 grant; ensuring appropriate data storage and presentation. Major skills include cellular biology, histology, immunology, molecular biology, cell culture, ELISA, blots. Must be able to work independently and mentor students. The project will take place within the Oral Immunology and Infectious Diseases research group at the School of Dentistry.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Conduct research in the field of cell biology, immunology and molecular biology in consultation with the PI. Maintain experimental animals, perform bacterial inoculations and dissect tissue. Organize data collection related to research projects. Prepare written reports and documents pertaining to data management, research methodology, and study resultsRead background literatureMaintain relevant training and complianceMaintain laboratory biological and chemical stock materials

Preferred Qualifications

BS relevant field

Over 10 yearsâ€™ experience in biological research

Target Compensation Maximum:

$77,600.00

Target Compensation Minimum:

$51,700.00

Compensation Will Be Commensurate To Candidate Experience.

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of Louisville is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, age, color, national origin, ethnicity, creed, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, pregnancy, or veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact the Employment team at employment@louisville.edu or 502.852.6258.

Assistance and Accommodations

Computers are available for application submission at the Human Resources Department located at 215 Central Avenue, Ste 205 - Louisville, Kentucky 40208.

If you require assistance or accommodation with our online application process, please contact us by email at employment@louisville.edu or by phone 502-852-6258.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
